key_dates.description: First turning point. Aligns with weekly cycle ending.
Second turning point (14-15.8 range). Potential reversal.

seasonal: Bearish: 10 of 15 years (66.7%) Bitcoin finished August negatively. Limited history makes seasonal stats less reliable.

statistics.description: In 6/7 years (~86%) Bitcoin traded lower on Aug 22 vs Aug 10.
Reference date for Aug 10-22 downward pattern.

insights: Bearish seasonality: 66.7% negative August finishes historically.
Monthly and weekly cycle ending around Aug 8. Strong daily cycle on Aug 7 aligns - significant reversal possible.
After ATH breakout attempts at end of July, need to determine if genuine or early correction approaching.
Weekly chart: no volume expansion despite rise. MACD/RSI negative divergence - momentum weakening.
Moderate scenario: correction to $105K-$98.5K. Negative scenario: fall to $74K support.
Large holders shrinking available supply could override bearish technicals.
Crypto market high dynamics require real-time monitoring via Discord.
$74,000 critical long-term support determining further direction.

technical.indicators: MACD/RSI negative divergence on weekly. Volumes not expanding. No genuine weekly breakout. Daily near key MAs with narrowing pattern.

summary: Bitcoin August 2025: bearish seasonality (66.7%) with four turning points (Aug 7, 14-15, 20, 27). ATH breakout attempts face MACD/RSI divergence and non-expanding volume. Aug 10-22 has 86% downward probability. Support $74K critical.
previous_month_review: July: 5 dates. 04.07=low, +10% move. 11.07=failed (1 day only). 18.07=high in narrow range. 24.07=low of previous cycle (+1 day deviation). 30.07=appears as low on support.
risk_notes: MACD/RSI negative divergence on weekly - momentum weakening.
Volume not expanding despite rise - breakout quality uncertain.
